intro: Licaria alata, commonly known as the spreading licaria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its hairy, palmate leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Licaria alata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
